title.narrative: Sri Lanka: Primary Health Care System Strengthening Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to increase the utilization and quality of primary health care services, with an emphasis on detection and management of non-communicable diseases in high-risk population groups, in selected areas of the country and to provide immediate and effective response to an Eligible Crisis or Health Emergency.

participating-org.narrative: Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Ministry of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I, A.2: The Borrower shall establish, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, and thereaftermaintain, until the completion of the Project, a National Steering Committee to monitor the implementation progress and provideoverall oversight and guidance

title.narrative: Percentage of annual procurement by MSD that is less than or equal to defined performance benchmarks (DLR 6.3)
Percentage of screened adults with high risk for non-communicable diseases who are registered and actively followed-up at primary medical care institutions (DLI 9)
The use of the urgent procurement procedure as a percent of total medical supplies procurement that is reduced from the establishedbaseline (DLR 6.5)
The number of primary medical care institutions that have the required capabilities for providing comprehensive and quality care. (DLI 3)
Percentage of PMCIs with capability for primary detection and management of dengue
Number of women at age 35 and at age 45 years who are screened for cervical cancer at a network of public health facilities (DLI 8)
Percentage of public sector schools implementing health promoting programs (health promoting schools)
Adequate and timely release of treasury funds requested to health sector program
Percentage of Medical Officers (both Medical Officers of Health in the Public Health stream and Medical Officers at PMCIs) trained on essential service package on NCDs
Number of PMCIs that use personal health records to coordinate patient care over time and through the referral chain (DLI 5)
Number of PMCIs with active community engagement committees (DLR 7.5)
Number of patient-friendly services provided on the basis of 4 types of services at the PMCIs (DLI 4)
Percentage of MoH and district training/capacity building plans developed and monitored
Number of annual progress reviews on MoH Action Plan, including Project Results Indicators at the central MoH
Percentage of PMCIs with capability for TB screening and referral
Number of innovative subprojects supported, evaluated and disseminated
Percentage of PMCIs with transport facilities for dispatching the samples for investigations to apex laboratories
Percentage of PMCIs providing a standard primary oral health care package
Number of PMCIs connected to and using the Medical Supplies Management Information System (DLR 6.1)
Percentage of Medical Officer of Health areas offering mental health services in at least one PMCI
Percentages of PMCIs with basic emergency care facilities
MoH adopts and updates clinical protocols for selected health conditions (DLI 2)

baseline.value: No clinical protocols targeted for the PHC level exist for the defined tracer conditions

target.value: MoH adopts updated package of protocols for defined selected health conditions

actual.value: Package of protocols adopted for defined selected health conditions.

title.narrative: MoH and Provinces endorse policies and standards for reorganizing PHC (DLI 1)

baseline.value: Policies and standards sufficient to guide PHC Reorganization do not exist

target.value: MOH and each Province endorse circulars and standards necessary for PHC restructuring

actual.value: MoH and Provinces endorse the package of circulars and guidelines necessary for PHC model implementation.

title.narrative: Community Engagement Mechanism for health sector operational, including grievance redressal mechanism (DLI 7)

baseline.value: There is no operational community engagement and grievance redressal mechanism

target.value: MoH makes public consolidated annual report for the health sector grievance redressal mechanism

actual.value: An operational community engagement and citizen feedback mechanism in place, especially for users of PMCIs.

title.narrative: Number of institutions benefiting from improved digital tools for secure and resilient continuity of operations
CERC implemented according to the Emergency Action Plan
Tele-education broadcasts available in all nine provinces
Number of direct project beneficiaries reached with seeds, planting material, compensation, equipment, works and services for COVID-19 recovery, segregated by gender
